title: Locked champs for ARAM to stop rage quiting
body:
Hi Riot Team,

Would like to put forward the idea of locking in the random champ that is allocated for champion select in ARAM to persist across games if players rage quit during champion select, to deter rage quitting on account of the champion they have been randomly allocated.

The lock in could apply based on a time frame, such as 2 - 24 hours, or until completing an ARAM, whichever comes first.

For example, if they are allocated Yoric, then if they quit during champion select the next time they start an ARAM game within the above time frame then they have no choice but to play Yoric. Disabling rerolls as well.

Very frustrating getting a great champ and a good team line up, then having someone rage quit and ending up with a champ you're not good at in the subsequent random champion select.

Thanks for your consideration.

replies.body:
I was having a conversation about this with someone recently, we couldn't see eye to eye either.
I know it's sad that you missed on a champion you liked because someone dodged, but at the same time, they weren't forced into playing a champion they hate? See, to me that sounds like it's all balanced out, the issue is done and you get to queue up again.

Yet I see quite a few people on here, talking about how dodgers should be punished harder. To what end? so people are so afraid of what RIot might do to them that they will play a champion they hate, even if it means having a miserable game?

Yes, ARAM stands for All Random All Mid, but can you really be expected to be willing to play all 140~ champs?

Everyone has a playstyle, so logically there are champions that each person will perform poorly on, and with how toxic our community is, can you really blame someone for not wanting to play a champion they can't perform well on?

They'll just be flamed by their own team all game, been there before.

You can't force people to play a game they don't want to, it's as simple as that and there really is no grey area.

Tl;DR: Check your privilege.
I think they have some better things to target before even thinking about adjusting Aram
"Better" is a subjective word, careful what context you use it in :P
ARAM is riots middle finger to the gamers. They know its unbalanced, they know certain champs are insta wins. Yet... do nothing

I like to think of this as rather than punishing those who leave (by forcing a champ on them they didnt want), keep the lobby open when someone leaves, all summoners stay in queue with the champs they have, until another solo'qer comes along and joins the room.
It's not like the new comer will be at a disadvantage to losing a lane they wanted, or champ they wanted, as thats obviously irrelevant in ARAM.
And sure it makes way for people to come and go as they please still, but how is that different to now, and how would waiting in the lobby ready to go be any different to waiting for another bunch of people to queue with?
This would allow those to keep the champs they have chosen, not waste any skin boosts or re-rolls they may have used, and if you decide to dodge well the rest can hang until another comes along and you get your time penalty as norm
